keyMoments.title: Heart Stopped by Wyper's Reject Dial
keyMoments.description: Wyper uses Seastone and a Reject Dial to stop Enel's heart in what appears to be a fatal attack.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that Enel can be harmed and killed through creative tactics combining Seastone and powerful physical attacks.

keyMoments.title: Self-Resurrection via Electrical Defibrillation
keyMoments.description: Enel uses his Goro Goro no Mi powers to restart his own heart after it was stopped by Wyper's attack.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Enel's incredible mastery of his Devil Fruit and his understanding of medical science. Establishes him as nearly unkillable.
keyMoments.quote: Did you really think that would be enough to stop a god?

keyMoments.title: First Use of 30,000,000 Volt Hino
keyMoments.description: Enel strikes his back drum to create a bird-shaped lightning attack with 30 million volts.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration of Enel's drum-based lightning shaping techniques.

keyMoments.title: First Use of Kiten
keyMoments.description: Enel taps his shoulder drum to create a wolf-shaped lightning attack that severely electrocutes opponents.
keyMoments.significance: Second drum technique revealed, showcasing his versatility in combat.

keyMoments.title: Reveals the Ark Maxim
keyMoments.description: Enel shows Nami his massive golden flying ark that will carry him to Fairy Vearth.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the vehicle central to Enel's plan to destroy Skypiea and reach the moon.
keyMoments.quote: Behold, the Ark Maxim! My vessel to the endless land!

keyMoments.title: Reveals Dream of Fairy Vearth
keyMoments.description: Enel explains his ultimate goal to travel to the moon, which he believes is the legendary Fairy Vearth.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals Enel's true endgame and foreshadows his eventual journey to the moon.
keyMoments.quote: Fairy Vearth... the endless land of sacred earth. That is where a god truly belongs.

abilities.description: Enel can use his electrical powers to restart his own heart if it stops, essentially performing self-defibrillation.
Enel strikes his back drum to create a bird-shaped lightning discharge with 30 million volts that attacks opponents.
Enel taps his shoulder drum to create a wolf-shaped mass of lightning that lunges at opponents with an electrifying bite.

reveals.information: Can restart his own heart using electrical defibrillation
Plans to travel to Fairy Vearth (the moon) using the Ark Maxim
Owns the Ark Maxim, a massive golden flying ship

keyMoments.title: Agrees to Accompany Enel
keyMoments.description: Nami strategically agrees to go with Enel to Fairy Vearth, hoping to find an opportunity to escape or sabotage his plans.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Nami's tactical thinking and survival instincts. She chooses strategy over futile resistance.
keyMoments.quote: I want to go with you to the Land of Dreams.

keyMoments.title: Discovers the Ark Maxim
keyMoments.description: Nami follows Enel to a cave where she sees the massive Ark Maxim for the first time.
keyMoments.significance: Nami learns about Enel's true plan and the scale of his preparation.

keyMoments.title: Flashback: Learning About the Shandia's Sacred Duty
keyMoments.description: Young Wyper is taught by the Shandia Chief about the 400-year struggle to protect the Poneglyph and reclaim their homeland.
keyMoments.significance: Provides context for Wyper's unwavering determination and the Shandia's generational mission.

keyMoments.title: Stops Enel's Heart with Reject Dial
keyMoments.description: Wyper uses his Seastone-equipped Shooter and a Reject Dial to stop Enel's heart in a devastating attack.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the tactical brilliance of combining Seastone with powerful weapons. Proves Enel can be harmed.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by 30,000,000 Volt Hino
keyMoments.description: Despite his incredible attack, Wyper is defeated by Enel's bird-shaped lightning technique.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the defeat of the strongest Shandia warrior.

reveals.information: Learned about the Shandia's 400-year mission from the Chief as a child

keyMoments.title: Attempts to Use Wyper's Seastone
keyMoments.description: After Wyper falls, Zoro grabs the Seastone weapon to use against Enel.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Zoro's tactical awareness in recognizing the value of anti-Devil Fruit weapons.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Enel's Kiten
keyMoments.description: Enel's wolf-shaped lightning attack defeats Zoro before he can effectively use the Seastone.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Enel's speed and power in defeating the Straw Hats' second-strongest fighter.

keyMoments.title: Escapes from Nola
keyMoments.description: Luffy and Aisa finally escape from inside the giant python Nola.
keyMoments.significance: Allows Luffy to rejoin the main conflict and discover the aftermath of Enel's attacks.

keyMoments.title: Discovers His Defeated Crew
keyMoments.description: Luffy finds his crewmates and the Shandia warriors defeated by Enel, learning about the dire situation.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Luffy's determination for the final confrontation with Enel.

keyMoments.title: Escapes from Nola with Luffy
keyMoments.description: Aisa escapes from the giant python alongside Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: Positions Aisa to use her Mantra abilities to help Luffy find Enel.

keyMoments.title: Uses Mantra to Sense Two Voices
keyMoments.description: Aisa uses her innate Observation Haki (Mantra) to detect only two remaining conscious people on the island.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates her remarkable sensory abilities and provides the key to locating Enel.
keyMoments.quote: I can sense only two voices left on this island. I can take you to them!

abilities.description: Aisa was born with the ability to use Observation Haki, allowing her to sense the presence and emotions of others across great distances.

reveals.information: Can use Mantra to sense voices/presences across the island

keyMoments.title: Teaches Young Wyper About the Shandia's Mission
keyMoments.description: In a flashback, the Chief explains the 400-year struggle to protect the Poneglyph and reclaim their homeland.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the generational nature of the Shandia's struggle and their sacred duty.
keyMoments.quote: We have fought for 400 years to protect the words inscribed on the Poneglyph and reclaim our homeland.
